text:
The Nongovernmental International Panel on Climate Change (NIPCC) is an international panel of nongovernment scientists and scholars who have come together to present a comprehensive, authoritative, and realistic assessment of the science and economics of global warming. Because it is not a government agency, and because its members are not predisposed to believe climate change is caused by human greenhouse gas emissions, NIPCC is able to offer an independent unbias expert opinion of the evidence reviewed – or not reviewed – by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on the issue of global warming.

NIPCC seeks to objectively analyze and interpret data and facts without conforming to any specific agenda. This organizational structure and purpose stand in contrast to those of the United Nations’ Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), which is government-sponsored, politically motivated, and predisposed to believing that climate change is a problem in need of a U.N. solution.

 • The NIPCC has been proving over and over for decades that Co2 does not cause climate change and that the Temperatures are not only normal and the same as they were 1,000 years ago, but they have VALID PROOF THAT THE HEATING OF EARTH IS ACTUALLY GOOD .

text:
Bernie switched ground on climate when Biden gave a more realistic overview of the time it would take to reduce fossil fuels to minimal use. Renewables are not sufficiently developed and integrated in the USA yet but nuclear power stations would accelerate the overall time. Cabling from these and from fossil stations is identical and once pure fission stations needed less output because of renewables organisation they could be closed down or gradually converted to thorium reactors -- straight to the same cables.
Thorium stations are admittedly complex and expensive to build but savings in maintenance and the bi-products of the technology would make it worthwhile planning the new fission stations for such flexibility.
American early thorium experiments were very successful but the materials for what we may call the 'plumbing' were yet to be developed.
Now they have been and further thorium development has occurred and especially in the last 5 years. 
These two professional politicians both show poor research knowledge and their party has failed to equip them because it remains stuck in its history of bickering about who cares the most. Virtue signalling without precise planning and streamlining of the Senate merely slows these well-meaning people down and trying a committee based bungled attempt to impeach a sitting president also robbed candidates of credibility at exactly the wrong time.

text:
@Jenn smith  Exactly.  You're exactly right.  It HAS happened before on this planet.  And guess what?  Conditions were by and large not as habitable to humans when it did happen.  Remember, humans have only been around for ~200,000 years, whereas the glacial/interglacial cycles have occurred over the span of hundreds of millions of years.   Humans have evolved in the lifestyle we're accustomed to precisely because the climate has been relatively stable in the short time humans have existed.  

You also don't seem to grasp what would happen with climate change.  It leads to overall a warmer climate, yes, but worsened extremes as well.  Countries with millions upon millions of people live near and on the equator would become extremely inhospitable, and in many ways deadly, to humans.

I'd encourage you to read about it.  Both sides.  I spent a lot of time reading climate deniers' websites, arguments, and videos.  Why?  Because I wanted to believe them.  I wanted to get comfort.  But deniers' arguments are all based on half suppositions, taking papers out of context, distorting facts- similar to when you read flat earthers' arguments.  Anyone with a little amount of time and effort could systematically dismantle most of the climate deniers' arguments easily.  Sometimes it takes a little research to figure out the con game the more sophisticated deniers do.

If you're young, disaster may or may not occur by the end of your lifetime.  But your kids, and definitely their kids, are in for a freaking doozy of a time.  Don't worry though, it's by and large too late and definitely out of the control of anyone like you or me.  Just keep planting your corn and burying your head in the sand.  At least you'll be happy in your denial.

text:
I WILL NOT TOLERATE THE FALSE CLAIMS OF JOE POSTMA (AND OTHERS) BEING PROMULGATED ON PSI AGAINST THE CAUSE OF DEFEATING THE AGW SCAM.

Just to update you all, back in 2012 Principia Scientific International (PSI) peer-reviewed and published my paper on radiation that was based on the work of Prof Claes Johnson and related to the resonating process whereby radiation from the atmosphere is pseudo scattered by the warmer surface and not thermalised. If it were then there would be a decrease in entropy and so we can deduce that the radiative forcing greenhouse conjecture is false.

I subsequently proved the first paper on PSI about the “Model Atmosphere” to be riddled with errors in its attempt to claim that all we needed was solar radiation to the surface in order to explain observed temperatures. It is so easy to understand why that is not the case because the Moon’s surface receives about twice as much solar radiation and does not simultaneously lose energy also by evaporation, conduction and convection as does Earth’s surface. The average temperature of the Moon’s surface is below zero Celsius and Earth’s global mean surface temperature would be less than 233K if solar radiation to the surface were the only reason.

So that leaves the world with no valid explanation for the global mean surface temperature of planets like Earth and Venus.

In 2013, after considerable research and thought, I explained what does happen on all planets and moons with atmospheres in my paper “Planetary Core and Surface Temperatures” on which was based my book published in 2014. It will probably take another decade or so before the truth in that paper is widely known and recognised.

The claim of AGW proponents that there would be an isothermal troposphere in the absence of “greenhouse” gases contravenes the Second Law of Thermodynamics as it would not be the state of maximum entropy, having more gravitational potential energy per molecule at higher altitudes and yet the same mean molecular kinetic energy and thus unbalanced energy potentials. Thermodynamic equilibrium is reached when there are no remaining unbalanced energy potentials and so the sum of (KE + PE) is homogeneous over altitude. Thus, since PE varies, so does KE, that is the temperature becomes warmer at the base of the troposphere (where PE is least) without any back radiation needed. All surface temperatures on all planets can be correctly explained based on this, so if back radiation could do extra surface warming then we would all cook.

Now that I have liquid funds in six figures I will by late next year be funding the establishment of a major class action by Australian companies affected financially by the hoax against the CSIRO and national and state governments, using responses to numerous Freedom of Information requests and being the main witness, as I can easily prove climatology claims false.

text:
Well, I'm not american, nor do I live there. However, I'm well aware of  the impact your elections have on the entire planet, as the rise of Neo-Facism in the faces of Orban, Erdogan, Modi, Johnson and specially  Bolsonaro were all validated and empowered by Trump's victory in 2016.  I'm brazilian and I live in the rainforest, I have lived here for most of my life and I can assure you Biden's plan is weak, greenwashed and naïve. If this man is elected as the next POTUS, the environmental neglect fueled by far-right policies will never stop, as his plans for the Amazon rainforest already existed under a fund called "Fundo Amazônia", co-signed by Norway and Germany in order to inject millions of Euros in the regional economy, so we would stop devastating the forest. It never worked, because while former presidents took their money they also allowed the agrobusiness to ransack southern and eastern Amazon, and turn most of it into cow pastures, bringing white brazilians to colonize the land in replacement of the traditional, indigenous people. So, Norway and Germany closed the fund, after wasting millions of euros, which, truth be told, helped to organize and fund some federal agencies who fight the mispratices  agrobusiness, but it's. Not. Enough.

While rich, industrialized countries do not ACTUALLY help struggling, developing nations in building their own green energy programs, their own sustainable economy, nothing will change. And it cannot be achieved by imperialist embargos  nor pumping greenwashing money, but through cooperation in science, economy, politics. 

TL:DR Joe is naive, vote Sanders PLEASE.
Abraços da Amazônia.

text:
​ @crypto flop  You really think so? Let's go through the clip.
The moderator asks Bernie for specific meassures in his policy to fight climate change.
Bernie responds to that by saying that we have to fight climate change and the situation is serious. The concrete meassures he suggests are to stop subsidizing the fossil fuel industry. He then asks for Biden's position.
Biden does in fact bring up Obama, fair enough. Then he talks about how serious he takes the issue, yadda yadda. Then at 2:50 Biden starts listin stuff he wants to do. It's quite a few suggestions. He finishes that at around 4:35.
Bernie responds brilliantly: "All well and good, but nowhere near enough". Bernie then talks about how we have to act boldly, and how we have to have courage. He says we have to "take on" the healthcare industry and the fossil fuel industry. But he doesn't present any actual policy. Wow, great reply Bernie.
Then Biden responds by listing more policies he wants to enact.
Then, at around 7:00, Bernie says it's not enough. He does suggest we should stop fracking, which I suppose is a policy. Then Biden responds with how he takes it seriously too. Now we´re at 8:49. Bernie once again states how serious the situation is, and lists no policy. Biden responds by listing stuff he has done in the past, and about building high speed rail, to reduce automotive traffic. Then the clip ends.

Bernie sucked in this clip.

The solar radiation reaching the surfaces of planets like Earth and Venus is nowhere near sufficient to explain the observed global mean surface temperature. There is an obvious need for an additional source of thermal energy into the surface. But, as Prof Claes Johnson explained, atmospheric radiation cannot be that source as it undergoes a resonating process and is not thermalized in the warmer surface. The ONLY correct explanation is at https://www.researchgate.net/publication/318008633_Planetary_Core_and_Surface_Temperatures
An explanation of resonant (or "pseudo") scattering of radiation is at
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/317997916_Radiated_Energy_and_the_Second_Law_of_Thermodynamics

*Sustainable Energy Transition proposals (non-100% renewable)*
-“ NREL Renewable Electricity Futures Study: A meta-development study from 7 US national labs and MIT” - I support this. 

Vol. 1: “Exploration of High-Penetration Renewable Electricity Futures”
https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy12osti/52409-1.pdf

Vol. 2: “Renewable Electricity Generation and Storage Technologies”
https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy12osti/52409-2.pdf

Vol. 3: “End-use Electricity Demand”
https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy12osti/52409-3.pdf

Vol. 4: “Bulk Electric Power Systems: Operations and Transmission Planning”
https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy12osti/52409-4.pdf

text:
His entire Grassroots Movement is taking him seriously as well as the 100's of people who've Endorsed him. Age shouldn't matter in a Election. Nor should one's gender or sexual orientation, race, religion, none of that should matter. What matters is a candidate who's polices and ideas bring about positive changes. Someone who remains consistent and won't deviate from going forth to achieve and instate those polices for the people. That is leadership. We as voters have to decide on who's polices resonate with us and for the betterment of the Country as well as if that candidate will fight for those policies. Anybody can say this or that but you need a track record and history of fighting for those polices your pushing. If you don't have that how can you be expected to be taken seriously in the people's eyes? Again it's because of those very reason's people are taking him seriously.


Look at how the entire DNC and Democratic runners have turned to square against him. You turned to bring down your front-runner after winning Iowa, large win in New Hampshire, and then another large win in Nevada. The reason being is they have Corporate interest and don't really care about the American people. Like really Joe Biden placed 2nd in Nevada, placed 4th in New Hampshire, and again 4th in Iowa. By statistics Pete was the stronger candidate to go against Bernie after the early state primaries. But that didn't happen instead he dropped out to support Joe Biden as did Amy and eventually Yang. They were clearly all promised something in return if Job Biden were to win. The other factor is Media News has set a negative narrative on why Bernie isn't electable when compared to Joe Biden. Joe Biden didn't have any momentum moving forward yet somehow is now the front runner. Really what are the reasons for that? Yet listen to the pair of them. Who has the better track record, better policies, the youth vote and independent voters you'll need to defeat Trump, all those things that'll be needed to win in the Presidential Election. It's the older demographic that is falling prey to the Media New's narratives on why Bernie Sander's isn't electable or the candidate to defeat Donald Trump which just isn't true. You have a situation where this older demographic is supporting a candidate who has advocated for cutting all Social Programs where as with the other he wants to expand it and cover everyone. These are programs that demographic is more heavily dependent upon vs other aged demographics. They simply aren't fact checking and believing what the Media has to say and 30-40+ years ago before the Internet or other means of Media this would've been true. The issue now is Media News gets to present things before nearly everyone else on a massive scale. By doing so they can easily tweak or bend the truth or lies to their liking. That's setting a narrative which is damaging.

text:
Bugsea Yang claims that Thorium reactors are meltdown proof and cannot be made into weapons. This is not accurate. 

1. The USA has had two commercial LWBR with Thorium Cores at Ft Vrain and Shippingport which present many of the same meltdown risks as conventional reactors. 

2. The USA and UK tested nuclear weapons from Uranium 233 in the 1950-1960s and India replicated the process and tests in the 1980s.

Uranium 233 is the fissile fuel made from Thorium 232 through a process called breeding. 

Breeding: 

Th-232 + 1n -> Th-233 (decay) -> Pa-233 (decay) -> U-233

What Yang is likely referring to is a very specific reactor that is not called a thorium reactor. It’s called a LFTR, which stands for Liquid Flouride Thorium Reactor. This reactor belongs to the MSR or Molten Salt Reactor family. 

The difference between a LFTR and a BWR or PWR is not that it uses Thorium. The massive differences are: 

1. LFTRs do not use water coolant - they use fluoride compounds 

- LFTR coolants have much much higher boiling and freezing points than water. 

- LFTR fuel is dissolved in its coolant and run as a liquid

2. LFTRs do not use solid fuel

3. LFTRs do not use fuel rods

4. LFTRs operate at much higher temperatures 

5. LFTRs do not operate in high pressure (except for specific sections of the reactor core)

What Yang is primarily talking about from a safety standpoint has far more to do with the coolant used in a reactor and the operational procedures of the reactor than using Thorium.

For example other MSRs have similar safety risks as LFTRs, but don’t use Thorium such as IMSR, MCFR, MSFR, MSAHTR.

text:
In its response to the coronavirus epidemic, the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) has shown how a totalitarian regime considers it more important to maintain its power than to ensure people’s health and safety.

Initial Cover-Up
According to a study published in The Lancet on January 24, 2020, titled “Clinical features of patients infected with 2019 novel coronavirus in Wuhan, China,” the first reported case of the novel coronavirus was on December 1, 2019. 

Another report by the Chinese media Caixin also revealed that several hospitals in Wuhan sent nine cases of unidentified pneumonia for sequencing before the end of December 2019, and the results indicated that the patients were infected with a novel coronavirus similar to SARS. 

Shortly after the hospitals reported the results to the Hubei Municipal Health Commission and the National Health Commission, they were told in January 2020 to stop all testing and destroy all samples. No data was allowed to be published.

While a few infection cases have been reported in December 2019, the local government affirmed in the media that the virus wouldn’t have human-to-human transmission and that the virus was “preventable and controllable.”

Eight doctors who shared information about the virus with their friends on social media were arrested on January 1, 2020 and charged with “spreading rumors.” Dr. Li Wenliang, one of the whistleblowers, later contracted the deadly virus and passed away on February 6, at the age of 34.

Despite all the early reported cases, several large gatherings still took place in Wuhan in January 2020, including the People’s Congress meeting, the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference, as well as a potluck party with over 40,000 families in attendance.

When Zhong Nanshan, a respiratory expert, finally confirmed human-to-human transmission of the virus on January 20, 2020, the virus had already spread all over the country by people traveling for the Chinese New Year holiday.
author: Hui Li

text:
Of course "climate change" is real. There has never been a time in the life of our planet that the climate was not changing. 

Only 140 years ago the 500+ years of the Little Ice Age came to an end, after causing the deaths of 65 million + of people world wide. 

The coming of the ice, over thousands of millennia, has always caused death, extinctions and destruction. CO2 caused by human activity is less than 4% of the total CO2 in the atmosphere, but maybe if we don't reduce it we may be able to hold off the next period of global glaciation for a century or so, before the ice ends most, if not all, of our civilization.

Don't be historically myopic.
author: Richard Schaefer

author: Ultra Violet

text:
Ultra Violet It’s great to have passion, but his energy policy is just not good. Honestly the biggest thing right off the bat - it has zero data of any kind for infrastructure. 

That is absurd. 

This is an extremely technical industry that requires someone to have some understanding of the scale of systems used in this country. To just say we are going to throw $1.5 trillion at the problem and complete it in 10 years without any information describing capacity additions, VRE concentration, loading system, grid adjustments, storage capacity - it comes off as incredibly sketchy. 

Especially when you consider the fact that $1.5 trillion over 10 years is CRAZY LOW for infrastructure spending in the USA compared to pretty much every engineering analysis report.

I mean how do you even calculate the cost of infrastructure without knowing the quantity or type that’s going to be built? 

Additionally I have major issues where he is planning for federal agencies to gain control of system that they are fundamentally not designed nor have ever managed in their history. 

So in the Sanders GND he states that PMA- Power Marketing Administration will own and manage all renewable generation under the GND. 

This is incredibly bizzare. PMAs were created in the early 1900s in the USA to sell power to farming communities near federal dams that would generate excess electricty when water was released in irrigation seasons. The electricty was sold at the lowest market price so as to not create increased economic turmoil for lower income communities (This is important and ill get back to it). Later in the 1930s  the markets for sold power were extended to all nearby utilities of federal dams so as to provide below market energy and ramp up the growth and profit for the electrical industry in the New Deal. 

How do PMAs sell electricity at the lowest market or below market energy prices? Because they receive zero interest loans from the US treasury. Now why does the US treasury do this? Because the assets receiving the loans have consistent high supply, high operating capacity and high consistent production, therefore posing low risk for beneficial investment. 

The three characteristics above exist ONLY for hydroelectric. They do not exist for solar nor wind, which is in part why PMAs have never owned nor managed solar and wind. 

Yet under Sanders GND not only will they suddenly somehow start selling this energy - they have the sole ownership of all solar and wind production. 

I have no idea how Sanders thinks this is a good idea... Why on earth give sole ownership of likely the majority share of energy generation to a federal entity with zero experience managing it, instead of allowing public and private utilities that currently manage it to continue to do so at an increased rate of production?

  ... which is a method of extracting natural gas.  The shift towards natural gas and away from coal has resulted in reduced U.S. carbon emissions.  So how can the U.S. transition to your targeted goal of zero emissions with fracking completely out of the picture?

Because we have to invest in an unprecedented way -- in an unprecedented way.  You started off by saying that we're talking about a $13 trillion, $14 trillion investment.  That is a lot of money.  And 
I've been criticized for that.  But I don't know what the alternative is, if we are playing for the future of this planet.  So we've got to be dramatic.  And what being dramatic is, massive investments in wind, in solar, under the -- in sustainable energies in general, in research and development, in making our buildings all over this country. 
 
My state of Vermont and around this country have got a lot of old buildings.  We can put millions and millions of people to work making our buildings energy-efficient, moving our transportation system to electricity. 
 
So what we're talking about is a massive unprecedented investment. That is what the Green New Deal is about.  I supported it.  And I will fight to implement it. 
 

TAPPER:  Thank you so much, Senator Sanders. 



http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/2003/15/se.03.html

text:
If he cares so much why does he not consult with FERC or the US DOE or scientists and engineers who are producing plans? 

1. The majority of energy transition plans are NOT in favor of 100% Renewable

2. ZERO 100% renewable plans published to date have 10 year timeframes. 

3. The majority of published studies SUPPORT carbon capture. 

Sanders is not an authority on this subject and his plan contradicts much of the existing science.
author: Brian

text: Brian did u hear the part when he was talking about working with scientist
author: Jacklyn 0000

text:
Jesselyn Olmo Yes he talks about that a lot, but then I look at his plan and it illustrates that he has not been in communication with them. 

Literally zero scientific studies use a 10 year timeframe, so where on earth did that timeframe come from? 

He even has the balls to claim that the IPCC supports his plan for 100% by 2030. 

Not only does the 2018 IPCC Special Report on CO2 emissions not support 100% renewable by 2030 - it doesn’t even support 100% renewable on any timeframe... And the IPCC report literally calls for an increase in nuclear and CCS technologies through 2050. Sanders GND does the complete opposite and states that these technologies will be removed. 

I guess Sanders team never actually read that report...

Furthermore he has provisions in his plan that completely undermine the current management structure of the US Department of Energy. 

For example he states that all PMAs will own transmission, all renewable generating assets and manage a wholesale electricity market including the additional one he will insert for the remaining 17 states.

A few issues: 

1. Not all PMAs own transmission. SEPA for example does not own, build or manage any transmission lines. 

2. PMAs solely own federal hydroelectric dams. They are not designed or have any experience owning and managing solar and wind farms or storage facilities other than hydro. 

3. There already exists a wholesale electricity market for the remaining 17 states that are currently not covered by a PMA. This market is operated by MISO, NYISO, OEISO, NBISO and PJM Interconnection. These are Independent System Operators (ISOs) and Regional Transmission Organizations (RTOs) that in addition to managing this market manage the Eastern Interconnection as part of the North American Electrical Grid. RTOs and ISOs report to FERC - that’s the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, who is literally never talked about in his entire GND. Like how on earth do you even do that? 

Likely the single most important (or at least top 3) government agency for energy never talked in an energy policy!!! How do you do that?!!

If he’s talking to scientists and engineers how on earth does he not know these things?
author: Brian

text:
Jesselyn Olmo I don’t even understand the benefit in his some of his provisions. 

What is the benefit of restricting renewable energy ownership only to the PMAs, Bureau of Reclamation and TVA? 

PMAs have never owned anything besides hydro. 

BC have never owned any generating assets. 

TVA primarily owns fossil fuels and hydro. 

You don’t like private utilities? Fine, I think that’s a poor decision, but even still why not provide financial incentives to any of the 160+ PUBLIC UTILITIES in this country to either continue developing renewable growth or begin transitioning to more renewables?!

There are current public and even * gasp * private utilities that currently manage and own more solar and wind generation than all three of these federal entities combined...

text:
Jesselyn Olmo I’m sure he does care. A lot people certainly care. Many of these new organizations care like the Sunrise movement. 

Does that mean they have any clue wtf they are talking about when it comes to solutions? Absolutely not. 

I certainly care, and even though I know a lot more than a lot of people I would not say I’m an expert. 

This is why in my last comment I’ve given you 46 sources from published studies on the subject. The first 14 of which are plans on how to fix the crisis both from the position of 100% Renewable and from Sustainable (which is the camp I support).

*I understand most media outlets don’t want to talk about scientific sources, because they are long, sometimes boring and sometimes very technical. However if we want to truly solve this thing we need the plan to be based around science and engineering not whatever platitude is going to get a candidate elected.

** I have additional sources of information or if you are interested in a particular topic I may have something to provide you with. If not I’d recommend looking the subject on Google Scholar, Research Gate or Science Direct Mediums. Most of the sources I’ve provided do not have paywalls but you may run into this problem with some sources you find. 

I’d also heavily advocate that you watch seminars from US National Labs as they provide extremely good information on these topics in many cases a laymen’s explanation or educational setting. Additionally US National Labs have the technology to run reports at scale whereas other institutions don’t exactly have the ability to run the efficiency losses for the entire power grid that spans 700,000 miles. 

I’d very very very strongly recommend Watching videos from ANL, PNNL, NREL, LNL, and BNL and have left a seminar video below talking about the US Electrical Grid: 

-“Argonne OutLoud: Ensuring a Resilient Power Grid”
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=rJ-57hrPovc

author: Nick's Garage

text:
Nick's Garage I’m ranting a lot on this, but energy policy is my key issue for politics (with some bias as I work in this industry). The thing is, I’m barely scratching the surface. 

This is the first election cycle that some higher education energy topics have been brought up, which is fantastic, but it’s incredibly bs that a lot of people (particularly progressives) have all of sudden taken a very specific side on energy policy, without really understanding what they are advocating for especially at scale. 

To think that we could install solar energy on every living sole’s home in the USA - that’s a full 7.5kW hr array on some 160 million + buildings. That alone in 10 years is a massive feat, and yet we would likely be generating about 1/3 of the Total US Electricity Generation. That’s crazy. 

Our scale of development in energy is almost incomprehensible and incomparable to any country. 

Our current solar industry, which lags behind China and makes up less than 1% of this country, produces more energy than the production of 160 countries! 

Just being green on your own - won’t cut it, so we need to actually think and formulate a real plan on how we can best reduce carbon emissions in this country for our energy industry.

Don't count on anybody doing this. Media News is setting the Narrative on making it seem Joe Biden is more Electable and he isn't. Such as well his percentages were significantly less than during 2016. Well of course they were. Look at how many more people were running in 2020 as opposed to 2106. When you have more people pushing different policies it divides those votes up. So if anything he did a much better job as opposed to 2016 as a result. Or you could look at them saying look at his narrow lead. If you take so & so's percentages he's trailing behind. So his lead really isn't that much. It's whatever Media News can use or spin negatively to set the narrative and people are believing it. 


What has to happen is we need a strong Media presence that'll do fact checking with absolute accuracy. A group of moderators who'll challenge and fact check what's being said and present those findings to the American people. We need a presence that'll hold people accountable and in check. Like during the debates we should have moderators fact checking. Any one of the moderators during this Debate could've fact checked Joe Biden on advocating about cutting all Social Programs and not just Social Security. 


All I'm saying is don't expect Media News to cover this or reveal Job Biden's pathological lies. These are Corporate entities who's higher ups wish to protect their investments and wealth. text:
@Arlando Little  In your original response you stated '@DyesubDave there will never be electric planes. You need fuel , ignition an air for combustion for flight.'  Well a quick Google search tells me otherwise.  Not big commercial flights but smaller passenger flights are definitely in our near future.

https://mashable.com/feature/electric-airplanes-future-flight/

https://theconversation.com/electric-planes-are-here-but-they-wont-solve-flyings-co-problem-125900

So while there are certainly hurdles to overcome it seems there are several currently in development.  As you mentioned the initial thrust would be one of the main issues.  Perhaps fuel for thrust switching to electric for flight would be more reasonable.  From the first article it seems that large commercial flights are likely 20 years away.   'Looking at this more realistically, a true electric passenger flight taking a plane-full of passengers from New York to London is 20 years off. And that’s being generous.'  However the other article states that smaller flights might only be a few years away.  'It is possible for small aircraft to be powered by electricity. In fact several companies are already developing small electric aircraft and they could come on the market within the next few years.'   So it seems that there WILL be electric planes and some possibly sooner than I expected.
author: DyesubDave

text:
@Arlando Little  Well you apparently don't know much then.  I have a decent paying job, raised my son on my own and have had a lot of hard-working construction type jobs in my younger years.   I think that you're the one living in a fairy tale land where things apparently never change.  You want to read the same story OVER and OVER and OVER again.  Some changes suck and are hard to deal with and some better society as a whole.  NOT trusting the government I understand but the current state of the country is not sustainable and something needs to change!  Some people thought Trump would change it.  I think he made it worse.  The status quo certainly isn't working.  Look back to when the country was doing well, people could afford housing, could pay off student debt, weren't drowning in medical bills.  What type of government existed then?  It was a government that was still divided but had some decorum and actually worked TOGETHER to solve problems.  The rich were certainly taxed at a higher percentage than they are now and the economic inequality was nowhere near what it is now.  All this information is easily searchable online. 



Today there is far too much corruption and greed in politics ON BOTH SIDES and in the corporate world.  Money doesn't make the world go round ... PEOPLE DO!   Countries need to invest in their people and, in turn, will have a much happier and productive society.  A few of the wealthy are just starting to figure this out now and some companies are as well.  But the majority are just greedy pricks allowing the ones at the top and the shareholders to reap the benefits while the remainder are basically just slave labor.   With unfortunately not many places to go due to unemployment and the all too common previously mentioned greed aspect.  Do you not realize that those in power WANT us divided?  If we're fighting amongst ourselves we won't band together and DEMAND that they do their job properly.  So when people say 'It's all the other side's fault' then those people are just giving them what they want.

text:
Assuming journeys are necessary in the first place, travel only by 
bus, cycling, walking or train. No parents taxi service. No flying 
except in an emergency. No spring water in plastic bottles, No imported 
food or food out of season when there is a local alternative. Little 
meat, dairy or fish, no hot daily showers, an embargo on throw away 
fashion clothes, no cotton. Infrequent washing of clothes in tepid water
 and no artificial drying. Drastic reductions of energy guzzling 
internet and social media, with smart phones and computers rationed to 
one a household and kept for years, and used infrequently, and a 
considerable reduction in purchases of consumer goods, especially those 
that are non-essential. Curtailment of new entertainment, such as films,
 documentaries and TV, where extensive travel was necessary in their 
making. Minimal home and work place heating. Expect regular power cuts. 
Curtail vegan foods which have achieved mythical status on their ability
 to save the planet. Many vegan ingredients come from all over the 
world, often by air and have huge carbon footprints.




Only weekly cups of habitat destroying coffee and foregoing endless 
home deliveries of everything from fast food to shoes. No attendance at 
festivals or sporting events, especially overseas, or those that need to
 use floodlights and aren’t near public transport.




These measures are ‘low hanging fruit’. Other changes in lifestyle 
will become apparent, but students (and adults) endorsing the ‘Climate 
Emergency’ will need to make considerable sacrifices and adopt more 
frugal lifestyles and not just during school years when passions and 
certainties burn brightest.

text: He hit em with the "no u".
author: first last

text:
@Boaz Chapman  "Bernie" is how they market the campaign. Whereas "Biden" is how they market his campaign. People just go with what is advertised as it's what they know is normal. Biden vs Bernie also has a good ring to it so media will use that more than the others.



Going with Bernie and not Sanders is a good choice from a campaign perspective as it's friendlier as it's a first name, friendly is what you want for a more left wing campaign. It also sounds more punchy as it starts with a hard consonant. Sanders is pretty common surname and most importantly has no hard consonants so it's not punchy at all. I imagine they didn't choose Joe for a similar reason, although it may have been a clever move to play into the whole working Joe shtick. There's no enforced rules on which name you market so this will always happen. 



Look at Barrack Obama, that's a punchy name that's fun to say, same with Donald Trump, George Bush, it's small things that change people's view at the first impression. Ronald Raegan - that's some good alliteration.


TL;DR Names are important, Bernie sounds more fun than Sanders; market that the most.

text: RBA1225 Exactly, we are causing the damage that the dinosaurs and animals before us were never able to cause. Life will continue for sure, just not in the way you think it will. Humans and most animals on earth right now can only survive comfortably at very specific conditions if you compare earth to other planets in the universe. How do you want future generations of humans to live before we die off? Should they suffer as they are forced to move to higher ground due to rising sea levels and the increasing toxicity of the ocean, not to mention the constant heating of the earth’s surface due to greenhouse gases, or would you like the prospect of humans living on for thousands of years while discovering technologies and science unknown to us now? I’m not crying and whining about it, I’m thinking ahead and I’m worrying about the future. I don’t care about the death of the universe or the supernova of our sun. Those things might be inevitable, but not one human will live to experience either of those events. Can we start focusing on helping the people of now and tomorrow and not blowing things out of proportion?

text: All of Sanders' positions recognize and work to decrease climate change. Biden offers no such policies and no programmatic changes to do same, because the partial changes are not enough. Biden still keeps everything the same, just lessened for the general public. Sanders' policies affect the ultra-rich, whose large yachts with several boats and planes affect immediately, for example. Biden doesn't even tackle such immediate and severe effects, because he will not stop the rich from doing anything. Sanders' policies are across-the-board changes for everyone, especially those whose impacts are great, like corporations and the lifestyles of the ultra-rich with their --yes! toys like submarines (their number one Christmas gift a few years back). Small changes and programs that take effect in 15 years have insignificant impact, especially when the GOP are then back into office and stop them again, as Trump has done.   Bernie is correct-- This is serious and Biden does not "get it". Stopping programs that harm the environment (like wars) is every bit as important, if not more important, than programs to pay companies to stop infractions of the laws. BTW, Bernie is known for his consistent and lifelong career toward these goals.Biden is known for his compromises with money that are controversial and will be used by Trump to defeat his election.

text:
"Climatologists are pessimistic that political leaders will take any positive action to compensate for the (cooling) climatic change. They concede that some of the more spectacular solutions proposed, such as melting the Arctic ice cap by covering it with black soot or diverting arctic rivers, might create problems far greater than those they solve. But the scientists see few signs that government leaders anywhere are even prepared to take the simple measures of stockpiling food or of introducing the variables of climatic uncertainty into economic projections or future food supplies. "The Cooling World - Newsweek - 1975"

text:
Look, people are going to do whatever they want and I'm not expecting to change the world with a YouTube comment.  But just a couple things for now:

(1) To anybody taking it for granted that Joe Biden would beat Trump...sorry, he'd get his CLOCK CLEANED by Trump because too many people (myself included) have finally decided we want someone who actually represents us, instead of their big money donors, and we're not settling for the "lesser of two evils" anymore.  But Joe Biden thinks every voter is a baby-boomer or older so he misses this stuff.    

(2) Opinions aside, Joe Biden told at least two egregious lies last night: (a) when he repeatedly denied trying to cut social security, that goes against his decades-long record of, wouldn't you know it, trying to cut social security!!! :)  Here's just one of many on-point clips: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RF6Sk0aoGpo.  (b) When Joe Biden claimed that the 2005 bankruptcy bill that he spearheaded didn't make private student loans non-dischargeable, that was also a lie.  I frankly don't know what he's even saying, here, but that was EXACTLY what the bill did and there's just nothing else to say about it.  Let me put it this way: this lie is literally so opposite of the truth that it would be like saying the First Amendment didn't create free speech, the Bankruptcy Code didn't create bankruptcy, etc.  This man is just VERY comfortable lying.    

Folks, again, I have no illusions that I'm changing the world, here, but Bernie Sanders is by far the better candidate and the day this country wakes up and gives Progressive policies a chance, the American middle class will rise up again as it did during the FDR years (which, wouldn't you know it, was the last time Progressive policies were mainstream in this country).  But if the public keeps buying the for-profit media hype and enabling bought-and-paid-for corporate hacks like Joe Biden, the fate of the American middle class will continue to get worse indefinitely.  I guarantee it.

text: As time has passed down through the ages one thing is clear. Mankind is mortal. Death is imminent from the moment of birth or even before birth. It may come inside the womb, one year old 40 years old 90 years old. Nothing will stop it. So whatever success may be achieved it is ultimately doomed to fail. Everything that has been, that is or will be is tumbling towards judgement. We are but wisps of smoke. Here today, gone tomorrow. Great proclamations are made. Great discoveries are unearthed or witnessed in the heavens. But they've always been there. We were created from the earth. And everything we created was already here. In the elements of the earth. We are on a planet moving 63,000 mph through space within a spiraling galaxy moving a million mph through space !!!! The chances of DNA coming together exactly as it does to make us is 1 × 10 to the 24th power. That's beyond comprehension. That's impossible without a Creator. This dimension of time we exist in is winding to a conclusion. It doesn't matter what we believe. What is, is. It's in the air. It's been foretold. And whether or not you believe it doesn't matter. It will happen. It's happening. It's been happening from the beginning. One thousand years, one million years, one billion years is as one day to God. Time has no hold on Him who created it. Flesh is bound by its mortality. Spirit is immortal. Only by faith does the spirit in mankind awaken. Without it we'll remain blind. Trapped in the moment. Leaving the past behind with each passing step or heartbeat and only glimpsing the future before it becomes the present then moves away to the past. Every single success or failure is therefore temporary. The only thing thereby that matters is the faith in the One in control and the hope of His blessed return. Which has always been a certainty. No matter what mankind thinks.

text:
We don’t want a Revolution; we want a New Deal.

The New Deal was a sweeping package of public works projects, federal regulations, and financial system reforms enacted by the U.S. federal government in an effort to help the nation survive and recover from the Great Depression of the 1930s. The New Deal programs created jobs and provided financial support for the unemployed, the young, and the elderly, as well as adding safeguards and constraints to the banking industry and monetary system.

Mostly enacted during the first term of President Franklin D. Roosevelt between 1933 and 1938, the New Deal was implemented through legislation enacted by Congress and presidential executive orders. The programs addressed what historians call the “3 Rs” of dealing with the depression, Relief, Recovery, and Reform—relief for the poor and jobless, recovery of the economy, and reform of the nation’s financial system to safeguard against future depressions.

The Great Depression, which lasted from 1929 to 1939, was the largest and most significant economic depression to affect both the United States and all Western countries. The stock market crash on October 29, 1929, is infamously known as Black Tuesday and was the worst stock market decline in the history of the United States. Heavy speculation during the rising economy of the 1920s combined with widespread buying on margin (borrowing a large percentage of the cost of investment) were factors in the crash. It marked the beginning of the Great Depression.

ThoughtCo.
By Martin Kelly
Updated October 24, 2019

text:
Message from Mathew , from the higher realms of light....?we shall address your questions about the mixed signals given by the multitude of sources reporting on the coronavirus. The continuous bombardment of information about this disease is bound to have inconsistencies—outdated or incorrect reports of numbers of positive, negative and inconclusive test results; the same about the numbers of deaths; and fear-laden speculation about what may be ahead.

With innumerable inner city, in-country and international travelers, a contagious disease naturally follows, thus it was not unexpected that the virus would spread far beyond China. Yet, more damaging to the society than this illness are the fear being generated about it and the finger-pointing at Chinese people wherever they are living.

Yes, it can be said that fear is “amplified by extreme measures” such as canceling major and local events and airline flights, closing schools, mass quarantining, and testing everyone who may have been exposed to individuals who later are diagnosed with the virus. Those precautions are sensible to curtail the spread of the disease to the extent possible and should allay anxiety, not add to it.

It is helpful that healthcare professionals are emphasizing there is no reason for panic. They explain the simple measures that help prevent getting the disease, whose symptoms are generally mild; that people who have health issues are the most susceptible; and compared to the numbers that have contracted the virus, the number of deaths is very low.

By no means are we downplaying, much less overlooking, the abundant emotions involved by asking this: Where is similar concern about the many, many thousands of deaths every day due to starvation, warring, domestic and random violence, vehicle crashes, suicide or chronic diseases due to substandard living conditions?

From our vantage point, it appears that the coronavirus’s disruptions of scheduled activities, travel, local and international commerce, and stock markets may be considered by the populace as significant as health concerns.

And yes, what we stated in last month’s message holds true: The coronavirus and all attendant publicity will fizzle out, and, like all other activities devised by the dark ones, diseases they design and let loose will come to an end.

Often we have urged you to send love-light to the dark ones because of all members of our universal family, they are most desperately in need of it. They cause terrible conditions worldwide because they are devoid of that energy except for the spark that is their life force.

Some of you have asked if there is a way to send only the light aspect of love-light to individuals who do abhorrent things. No, dear ones, there isn’t—love and light cannot be divided into two compartments. While you could say that light is the makeup of the soul and love is a capacity of the soul, those cannot be separated any more than the soul can be separated from God and Creator.

First of all, it is important to realize, whether it is natural occurring (which is a curious remark, is it not?) or shall we say, laboratory created, that any virus that in fact becomes alive (because there are many that are simply dormant) is related to the infection or the poison of emotions and belief systems. So the true story: The coronavirus was created in a laboratory. It was a weaponized virus and it has been let loose by those who have been (not intentionally, by the way, let loose) but by irresponsible handling of the toxin.

AAM: No. In fact, in the long run, it will not. Now, is it creating a difficult situation? Most certainly. But what it is also doing, it is actually doing two things in the bigger sense of outcome.

One, it is demonstrating the dictatorial nature of their culture, of their ability to restrain, contain, etc. And, so, it is bringing to the forefront again, collective and lineage memories of autocracy. So that is the first thing.

But the second thing is it is also creating and reinforcing within the collective, their own ability to rise to the situation that is extraordinarily dangerous and difficult.

text:
European here. It is very interesting to follow the debates etc. as an outsider. I have not been to the US (yet) so I don't know what it is like (to live) there with Trump as president (and in comparison to Obama prior). I can only go by what my american friends are telling me. Anyway, back to the debate/clip here. I think it is very obvious that Sanders has plans in mind, knows where he wants to go, a clear direction and you can tell by the confidence he emits when he makes his points. 

At least in this clip, Biden looks like he is struggling, he does not really know how to respond to some questions or problems and uses general filler phrases instead. The "no *new* fracking" part immediately caught my attention. That was a moment where he definitely thought about how much he can lie to his voters and/or to his backers/donors, walking the fine line of "technically saying the truth but leaving parts out". "No new fracking" is a very flexible term here. What exactly does count as "new"? Does for example any already planned fracking but not yet executed fall under that? Additionally, he goes off-topic many times, trying to mask the fact that he is either out of points or just not well prepared to talk about for example climate change.

Overall, I think Sanders absolutely won this one. He listens to scientists, researchers and other experts. And I mean actual experts from universities and research facilities etc. and not the random people the media often tends to label as such.

I am not going to tell you who you should vote for in this case but please think about it for a good while. You only have to do this every 4 years so it is not too much to ask to put a little bit of effort into informing yourself, comparing every candidates points, looking at their history etc. Use the internet and do not listen to the media. Believe what you want to believe after you feel like you understood most aspects of it, not because others told you to do so.

However, whatever you do, please do not re-elect Trump if you do not want to be the reason the US is the the laughing stock of this planet for another term.

text:
@Casale Smith  Universal healthcare means no one is excluded from going to hospitals and doctors...
What's more: if you set a goal as a society to provide everyone with healthcare, you work to attain that goal. If it means building more hospitals than it means building more hospitals. If it means train more doctors, it means just that. It is all about the goals you set out as a society and then you work on it to achieve those goals. The US is a very highly developed, industrialised country. It is not a particularly unattainable goal

text:
Create a Medicare for All, single-payer, national health insurance program to provide everyone in America with comprehensive health care coverage, free at the point of service.
No networks, no premiums, no deductibles, no copays, no surprise bills.
Medicare coverage will be expanded and improved to include: include dental, hearing, vision, and home- and community-based long-term care, in-patient and out-patient services, mental health and substance abuse treatment, reproductive and maternity care, prescription drugs, and more.
Stop the pharmaceutical industry from ripping off the American people by making sure that no one in America pays over $200 a year for the medicine they need by capping what Americans pay for prescription drugs under Medicare for All.


Guarantee tuition and debt-free public colleges, universities, HBCUs, Minority Serving Institutions and trade-schools to all.
Cancel all student loan debt for the some 45 million Americans who owe about $1.6 trillion and place a cap on student loan interest rates going forward at 1.88 percent.
Invest $1.3 billion every year in private, non-profit historically black colleges and universities and minority-serving institutions
End equity gaps in higher education attainment. And ensure students are able to cover non-tuition costs of attending school by: expanding Pell Grants to cover non-tuition and fee costs, tripling funding for the Work-Study Program, and more.


Double union membership within Bernie’s first term.
Establish federal protections against the firing of workers for any reason other than “just cause.”
Provide unions the ability to organize through a majority sign up process and enact “first contract” provisions to ensure companies cannot prevent a union from forming by denying a first contract.
Deny federal contracts to companies that pay poverty wages, outsource jobs overseas, engage in union busting, deny good benefits, and pay CEOs outrageous compensation packages
Eliminate “Right to Work for Less” laws and guarantees the right to unionize for workers historically excluded from labor protections, like farm workers and domestic workers.


Transform our energy system to 100 percent renewable energy and create 20 million jobs needed to solve the climate crisis.
Ensure a just transition for communities and workers, including fossil fuel workers.
Ensure justice for frontline communities, especially under-resourced groups, communities of color, Native Americans, people with disabilities, children and the elderly.
Save American families money with investments in weatherization, public transportation, modern infrastructure and high-speed broadband.
Commit to reducing emissions throughout the world, including providing $200 billion to the Green Climate Fund, rejoining the Paris Agreement, and reasserting the United States’ leadership in the global fight against climate change.
Invest in conservation and public lands to heal our soils, forests, and prairie lands.
End the greed of the fossil fuel industry and hold them accountable.

There are amply qualified scientists appearing all over Youtube that dispute the leftist 97% claims in terms of severity and immediacy of any required actions. In fact, the "97%-of-scientists poppycock" should read, "97% of liberal, tax revenue, government student loan subsidy and grant money dependent college professors (i.e. scientists) agree that climate change is a major threat and conveniently implore the government to keep funding them as long as they decree the need to do so." The colleges and professors keep getting richer while the rest of us subsidize their largesse and see our quality of life decrease exponentially. The government creating scarcity of resources is not an answer to anything other than to those who wish to Lord over us. I'm not interested in having know-nothing politicians and faceless bureaucrats Lording over me. If climate change can be affected by our actions then cutting the red tape and promoting Nuclear energy is the only thing these pinheads should be considering. I can't fill my gas tank with windmills or solar cells, afford to pay $10/gallon for gas or use my car as a planter, walk 40 miles to work each day, nor wish to be beholding to Iran, the Saudis or Russia for gas if we shut down our production. A replacement for gasoline in our cars will come in time but we're not there and shutting down our oil and natural gas production is akin to shooting ourselves in the foot. Isn't it funny that "progressive" college professors don't ever suggest shutting down the old-fashioned, wasteful educational model consisting of brick and mortar universities nor promote on-line earning which would eliminate people having to drive to school and the need to heat or cool large classroom buildings and ancillaries. Did any of the 97% suggest such a thing? Nah. You see, colleges and universities are big business just like the oil companies their "educators" like to disparage.

text:
Watching this from Finland just amazes me. How could you not choose Sanders? Biden has nothing. He wants you to go back to "normal", like before Trump. But it was exactly that "normal" that gave way to a guy like Trump. In other words, your country has a lots of problems to be solved like Bernie mentioned. What you need is a big renovation. And Bernie seems to be the only one willing to make them.

And no, I'm not saying Finland is perfect, but at least we have the basic needs for the people in place, such as universal healthcare, free education and paid sickleaves. And no, I'm not paying my ass off with high taxes for that either. And progressive taxation doesn't mean you can't become rich and stay rich. But do you need to be a billionaire? How about just a millionaire, surely that's more than enough for one people and he's or her's ambitions?

I don't want to be seen as condescending towards you americans. I care for you and your country. I simply and honestly want what's best for you.

You like to say you're the Greatest Country in the World. And I don't mind. But first you gotta put your shit together and start behaving like one. Take care of those in greatest need and then start building upwards.

Take care!

text: Big Bernie supporter, but he didn't actually answer the question. This is really more of a mitigation kind of question considering the fact that global warming no matter what we do will hit us in some way. How to reduce how bad it will be is the kind of stuff Jake Tapper is about how we could get malaria in Florida and Arkansas and who knows how far North. Biden answered to a small extent but it sounds like he was starting to go in a xenophobic Direction but then pulled back as he should because that's a bad place to go and had a half-assed answer. This is directly related to our current circumstance of covid - 19 where we need to think about not only the current crisis but how will deal with future crises in healthcare. The end my assessment is both candidates lost on this question. Bernie should have won cuz I feel like you should know better, but he didn't address the health issues especially disease transmission issues that will be part of global warming in the future. For example, viruses and bacteria that are released from glaciers that are human bodies have no idea what the hell they are because they haven't been around for who-knows-how-long. These are a thing. As is the fact that diseases that are more traditionally tropical diseases will be able to travel North as mosquitoes and other kind of vectors are able to flourish in latitudes they weren't able to before. It's also a matter of migration, we can't deny that fact as well but it's very dangerous to look at humans as the vectors. If there are real worries there are quarantine protocols that can mitigate that factor. The thing is is that mosquitoes are not going to willingly go into quarantine they don't care!

text:
I believe Bernie’s bringing in good common sense policy ideas at a time when they’re needed. 

Yet the powers that be seem to be exclusively pushing Joe Biden, who wants to bring things back to ‘normal’. 

The problem is that ‘normal’ isn’t good enough. And certainly not inspiring enough to draw in new voters. 

Add to this the high likelihood that Joe would realistically lose to Trump who would win all the debates. 

And the kicker, Trump would realistically lose to Bernie, whose ideas are just too popular not to bring out new voters. 

The only way I could see Trump winning in that scenario, would be if Trump co-opted some of Bernie’s ideas, which could be a good thing. 

And so if Biden wins the nomination, I expect that the next election will be all too easily won by Trump. 
And the American people yet again, from a policy perspective, will not have had two truly different candidates to choose from. 

On the other hand, Bernie vs Trump would be an electrifying election for the American people. 

And the winner of that election no matter who, could then stand up as the genuine representative of what the American people really wanted. 

Hoping for an exciting election.
author: Mr. Matt

text:
Vote for Biden?! Nonsense! What does Biden offer the people? He said to the rich; 'Don't worry. Nothing will fundamentally change.'. The rich isn't a monolith monster of the poor's nightmares. They are real people. Bankers, fossil industry execs, media execs, Wallstreet  suits, big pharma boys and such. They fund his campaign. They fund Republicans AND Democrats and have for years. That's who Biden spoke to. Their will be done. Their riches and wellbeing cared for. In decades of government, the House and Senate have worked to enact changes that benefit corporations and rich folks, not the average citizen. They do not reflect the public interest in their laws and votes. Look it up. This isn't hyperbole, it's fact. 

Biden wanted and worked for a lot of bills that ruined people's lives. Look up his record. He said he didn't care that young people are suffering. 'Give me a break!', he said when their struggles were brought up not too long ago. He wants to cut entitlements. He lies constantly. He lied tonight, many times and not one moderator fact-checked him! He lied and said he fought for civils rights and got arrested in South Africa trying to see an imprisoned Mandela. He's been lying for decades and steals glory. 

What does he offer regular voters? He says 'a return to normalcy, decency. America won't be a laughing stock.', yet what's decent about him? He inappropriately touches men, women and children (Trump's a rapist and sexual predator, so worse), lies (Trump lies too), curses voters (like Trump), threatens physical violence against voters (unlike Trump) who ask him questions, isn't bright (don't know which one is dumber), brags about the accomplishments of others - brazenly attributing them to himself (pretty much like Trump), he is in severe cognitive decline ( worse than Trump), he is corrupt; his corruption allowed him to collect donations (bribes) and then vote the way the donors wanted (same as Trump). His normalcy is going back to doing the bidding of his donors. That leaves the average guy to continue to not be able to discharge his debt, get a decent minimum wage, lose his job, not afford to go to the doctor when ill, worry a big, bad hurricane will blow his house down and much more. This is what is happening now. Biden offers the same existence as under Trump because they both work for the rich. Biden is a senile moron just like Trump (except Trump seems less senile). World leaders see this. World citizens see this and Biden's senility and lies are openly discussed in the news in various European countries and Australia (so the world will marvel at the incompetency and continue to laugh). Biden is factually incapable of governing just like Trump except Trump's dumber and lacts intellectual curiosity to learn to lead while Biden is senile and will be a puppet. So we suffer now, suffered under Obama, suffered before Obama, will continue to suffer under Biden. Biden wants wars and will continue to wage them just like Trump. He would veto Medicare for all, because his pharma donors and others don't want to pay practical taxes. So screw average Joe's illness! Let him go to the emergency room when his sickness is kiling him. So no, you're wrong. The orange monstrosity is horrible, but Biden's no better. Still not convinced? Trump appoints corporate friendly judges, so did Obama and so will Biden. Why? Money, corruption and the idolatry of big coperations are Biden's god. His record proves it. 

Biden claims he is against the ill treatment of migrants, wants to pass immigration reform and more, but never did anything to stop or help these issues, just the opposite. Claims he can get Republicans to work for and with him, yet sat his ass down and did nothing when he was Vice president?!? When someone has power and leadership and doesn't do shit, why give them more. To give it to them knowing your life will remain a misery and other poor demonized people's lives will not improve, is idiocy. It's not harm reduction because Biden will be harming us. Hyperbole?! No! He said he would veto Medicare for All if Congress passes it! Trump is a cancer, but giving senile puppet Biden who won't do any better, our vote, is suicide. By the way, who will be running the government??? Considering Biden's senility, he can only be a puppet. You don't even know WHO you're handing that power to!

author: Adriana Alva

text: @Adriana Alva yes I know that, but first of all he is planning to break big banks based on a measure of gross assets on national GDP, which is stupid since this measure does not provide information on risk exposure. He should rely on a measure of risk-weighted assets. Second of all, he is planning on financing a good portion of his program with additional transaction fees on the trading of stocks and financial derivatives which is also a short term funding method since markets will immediately find new ways to trade financial instruments and this could also compromise the efficiency of the overall markets, which means that markets will look for financial instruments abroad, not paying this fee he is introducing. Then he is planning on introducing universal healthcare. Let me tell you something, I am Italian and we do have universal healthcare but this implies a huge toll on your income taxes and I don’t know if America is ready for this. I love the ideas of Sanders and I do think he is a better candidate against Trump but let’s look at the economics of his ideas. Does not make much sense

But the direction Sanders has is one that has the earth's well-being in mind as well as humans', which is what i value myself. author: Adriana Alva

text: @Adriana Alva don’t get me wrong, I also think that Bernie’s program stands out and can be revolutionary for America but most of the time people don’t really know what they want. These are Social issues with an Economic base behind them. The ideas are strong but the means to achieve them, not so rational and strong. I’ll make you the Italian example. We have shifted towards a political trend of populism. Their political programs are generous with an amount of income promised to everybody, regardless of their willingness to get out there and actually look for a job. Everyone would want at least 600 euros a month but this implies a heavy weight on our fiscal budget, which is negative and on our outstanding national debt which has skyrocketed. People want many things from their governments but the majority does not understand the economic consequences of what they desire

text:
"We're gonna take on the healthcare industry, we're gonna take on the fossil fuel industry" 

OK, HOW? The President is not gonna be able to do these things by himself. All the President can do is hopefully corral Congress into shaping policy that lines up with his agenda, to varying results. Think about it, for how long we have had a "do-nothing" Congress. 

First off, you're not gonna be able to drastically change industries with government. That's where the public sphere and private spheres do NOT align. But let's just say by  some magical property that was the case, that this really was a massive Sanders Federal Government, that would require Congress to basically be unilateral in their support for every new thing he wants to pass legislation wise. It hasn't really been the case for a long time. 

If you want to effect change, think more carefully about who you are voting for in your congressional districts. They arguably have more collective power in that regard than any President ever could. By design. That's how the entire thing was built.

text: @White Cosby  You mean the social security bit? If you think Biden wants to or ever wanted to cut social security outside of in response to a budgetary and deficit crisis, based on what he said in that video and his record, you're clueless. He wanted to freeze almost all federal spending, and the one thing he DIDN'T want to freeze was social security. He wanted to freeze COST OF LIVING ADJUSTMENTS to social security for ONE YEAR while they froze almost all federal spending in attempt to address a perceived deficit crisis, that many at the time were sure was going to cause an economic crash. This means everyone would have received the same social security payment as the year before, it just wouldn't have been adjusted for cost of living for one year. Trying to spin this as him being against social security is nothing short of Bernie propaganda.
author: Noah McDaniel

text:
@Noah McDaniel  - This is confirming Sanders' claims, not undermining them. Numerous times, Republicans pushed for large cuts, and Biden offered smaller but substantial cuts, in compromise. This was a wrong approach many Republicans aim to eventually, incrementally eliminate these programs altogether. Creating incremental reductions allows the GOP to make progress towards eventual elimination. Bernie is right. In every instance, Joe Biden was urging what amounted to cuts in social security. You can spin and explain the context all you want, but that's the fact. I assume Bernie left out the fact that during the Obama Administration, Joe Biden supported cuts to social security as part of a so-called "Grand Bargain" with the Republicans, who were too stupid to take them up on it. I assume Bernie left out this most recent example of Biden supporting social security cuts because he didn't want to be seen as critical of Barack Obama.     

https://www.npr.org/sections/itsallpolitics/2013/04/05/176351738/obama-riles-his-own-party-with-social-security-offer

text:
BRAINSPLATTER16 There’s definitely ifs ands and buts. It’s called politics, bargaining chips, and balancing the budget. He’s proposed cuts to just about everything at one time or another, often as a deal with republicans to raise taxes. Obama did the same thing. 

The fact of the matter is Sanders KNOWS there’s no room for reasoned discussion in our political culture on WHY someone wanted to make cuts to social security at one point or another, and purposely took his words out of context in his attack ad. He knew exactly what he was doing and you’re ignorant if you can’t see it. In that video, he wanted to freeze virtually ALL federal spending including social security COLA’s, but NOT SOCIAL SECURITY. And what does Sanders do? Run an ad quoting the part where he said social security, when he meant cost of living adjustments, and was hoping his supporters were too dumb to understand the context of wanting to freeze federal spending to address a deficit crisis that many at the time thought would cause an economic crash. He was right.

Freezing social security COLA’s means everyone would have received the exact same social security check as the previous year, it just wouldn’t go up $24 to adjust for cost of living, for the duration of one year while the government balanced the budget. Oh but cuts are cuts! You’re either an existential threat to social security or you’re Bernie Sanders, its savior!

text:
In the late 1990s, when now - U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont was a member of the House, he supported a compact between Maine, Vermont and Texas that originally proposed dumping low-level radioactive waste in a small minority community in far-West Texas, putting him at odds with other progressive congressmen.

Bernie Sanders singled out the fossil fuel industry for criticism, listing it among the special interests he planned to take on. But in the final months of the 2016 campaign, Sanders repeatedly requested and received the use of a carbon-spewing private jet for himself and his traveling staff when he served as a surrogate campaigner for Hillary Clinton.

According to the latest campaign finance filings, Sanders cut checks totaling $360,350 to Apollo Jets, a private charter service based in New York, for the use of a private jet three times during the third quarter — once in August and twice in September

Neither one is going to do well vs. Trump. The best looking candidates in the race are long gone, but bad judgment is one thing liberals are kind of famous for. text: If you can't tell what he's saying, you are an idiot not worthy of political discourse. No, he does not and did not want to cut social security and medicare. He wanted to freeze them temporarily in response to a deficit crisis caused by Reagan's tax cuts that many believed would cause an economic crash. And he only wanted to freeze cost of living adjustments to social security for a single year, not social security. Meaning everyone would have gotten the same social security check as the year before, just not seen an increase that year for cost of living.

text:
RaptorRed Delta

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/01/biden-vs-sanders-on-social-security-and-medicare/

“Listening to Biden’s words or reading them in that fuller context, however, suggests a different meaning. After saying, “What’s the first thing he decided we had to go after?” Biden leaned close to the microphone and said in an exaggerated, ominous voice, “Social Security and Medicare.”

Biden was talking about a need to change the tax code to “deal with income inequity” and that the tax changes championed by Ryan and Trump worsen the problem.

“It’s [the tax code] wildly skewed toward taking care of those at the very top. It favors, overwhelmingly favors, investors over workers and it’s riddled with unproductive expenditures,” Biden said.

In that context, we think a reasonable person would conclude that Biden was mocking Ryan’s plan, and that Biden was arguing Republicans would use it to justify cuts to Social Security and Medicare.”

text: @PS Wright  You're describing Bernie supporters. The one's that don't know what a wealth tax is or that their candidate has proposed one over 2x higher than any other country even after almost every country that tried far smaller ones ended them because they were harming their economy. The ones that keep insisting Biden wanted to cut social security because Bernie says so when it's been proven repeatedly that he did not and never wanted that -- he wanted to freeze federal spending and cost of living adjustments to social security for the duration of one year to address a perceived deficit crisis. Meaning people would have still received their social security, only the same amount as the year before, and he wanted this along with freezing almost all federal spending. Representative of a difference in his fiscal ideology 30 years ago? Sure. Trying to characterize that as opposing and wanting to cut social security? Propaganda.
author: Noah McDaniel

text: @S Power  Imagine being so clueless you continue to believe something that's been proven false by many reputable sources. Biden wanted to freeze almost all federal spending, including cost of living adjustments to social security, *but not social security*, for the duration of one year to address a perceived deficit crisis. Meaning people would have received the same social security check as the year before, it just wouldn't have been adjusted for cost of living as the government reined in spending for a year to address what many thought at the time was a deficit crisis that was sure to lead to an economic crisis. Biden has always been a debt hawk, especially in his early years in politics. Characterizing this is being opposed to social security is BAD FAITH ARGUMENTATION AND PROPAGANDA.

text:
There’s a lot of confusion about the green new deal (Bernie Sanders’ plan):

It costs 16.3 trillion dollars... over 30 years!

The green new deal has one deadline by 2030 (100% renewable energy, etc.) and fully decarbonized economy by 2050. So it’s not that Bernie’s plan will cost 16.3 Trillion and that’s how much money you need to come up with in ONE year... It’s that by year 2050, it will have costed 16.3 trillion, and 16.3 trillion divided by 30 years is actually not expensive.

text: Did everyone hear the question that Jake Tapper asked, and this is a good example of what the big corporate media does to try to make a candidate look bad. And that was pretty shameful.  Jake Tapper is a snarky weasel, and he was that way even when he was with ABC.  If you have effective measures that can slow down and somehow prepare for all of the inevitable horrors from global warming, then the risk from whatever disease or damage to our health that global warming could possibly create would be of course be minimized as well.  This is a good example of why we can't even trust corporate media with a debate between two people.  The huge threat that global warming is waging upon us, which the corporate elite does not want to deal with because it gets in the way of business as usual,  is our number one threat.  The second number one threat is nuclear weapon proliferation, which the U.S. does not want to do anything about because our close friend in the middle east, Israel, would be the country more likely than not to use such a weapon on another country, but that phony corporate media hack Jake Tapper wouldn't want to talk about Israel and their nuclear weapons.
